description: Performs a test on an availability provider to ensure that access is allowed. For EWS, it verifies the provided credentials can be used to successfully log in. For Lambda, it verifies that the Lambda function can be invoked and that the resource access policy was configured to deny anonymous access. An anonymous invocation is one done without providing either a SourceArn or SourceAccount header.

parameters.name: OrganizationId
parameters.description: The WorkMail organization where the availability provider will be tested.

parameters.name: EwsProvider
parameters.description: Describes an EWS based availability provider. This is only used as input to the service. The endpoint of the remote EWS server. The username used to authenticate the remote EWS server. The password used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsEndpoint
nested_params.description: The endpoint of the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsUsername
nested_params.description: The username used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

nested_params.name: EwsPassword
nested_params.description: The password used to authenticate the remote EWS server.

parameters.name: LambdaProvider
parameters.description: Describes a Lambda based availability provider. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda that acts as the availability provider.

nested_params.name: LambdaArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda that acts as the availability provider.

nested_items.name: TestPassed
nested_items.description: Boolean indicating whether the test passed or failed.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: String containing the reason for a failed test if TestPassed is false.
